analyzed: lha sbyin autstsha ta ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: gzugs brnyan la tsher mas btab nas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] while pricking a mirror with thorns.

analyzed: lha sbyin m'a ra ya zhes sbyar na 'chi bar byed do //
translated: If one joins [the mantra] with 'Maraya of Devadatta', it will kill.

analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa la rang gi sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par sngags nas g-yul du 'jug par byas na rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted a sword and so forth with one's mantra one hundred and eight times, if one enters into battle, one will be victorious.

original: gang bya ba'i phyogs su gtor ma byin pas de 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang bya ba'i phyogs su gtor ma byin pas de 'grub bo //
translated: In whatever direction one should do [the rite], by giving a sacrificial cake, that will be accomplished.

original: sdig pa'i nad la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i nad la sogs pa la /
translated: In the case of sinful illness and so forth,

original: rma bya'i sgro la rang gi sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags nas bya ba par bya'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i sgro la rang gi sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags nas bya ba par bya'o //
translated: having enchanted a peacock feather one hundred and eight times with one's mantra, one should do [the rite].

original: che ge mo'i che ge ro ga n'a sha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: che ge mo'i che ge ro ga n'a sha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should join [the mantra] with 'Destroy such and such of Devadatta'.

original: nad thams cad zhi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad thams cad zhi par 'gyur ro //
translated: All illnesses will be pacified.

original: de bzhin du mche ba'i dug la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mche ba'i dug la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should apply [the mantra] to the poison of a fanged [animal].

original: lag pa'i mthil gnyis su'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i mthil gnyis su'o //
translated: [One should apply it] to both palms.

original: lha sbyin gyi bi sha n'a sha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi bi sha n'a sha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should join [the mantra] with 'Destroy the flesh of Devadatta'.

original: dug med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug med par 'gyur ro //
translated: [The poison] will become harmless.

original: de bzhin du gang gi dbang du bya @399b ba la ni rang gi gnas nas 'ongs te gcer bu skra grol ba mdun du bsams te 'gyel bar bltas nas bzlas pas dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi dbang du bya @399b ba la ni rang gi gnas nas 'ongs te gcer bu skra grol ba mdun du bsams te 'gyel bar bltas nas bzlas pas dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, one should visualize the target in front of oneself, naked, with disheveled hair, fallen down, and summon him or her from one’s own abode.

original: che ge mo bdag gi ba sha m'a n'a ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: che ge mo bdag gi ba sha m'a n'a ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should add, “So-and-so is under my control.”

original: de bzhin du sngon ma bzhin du dgug par bsams nas bzlas pas 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon ma bzhin du dgug par bsams nas bzlas pas 'gugs par byed do //
translated: Likewise, one should visualize the target as before, and summon him or her by reciting the mantra.

original: che ge mo a'a karsha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: che ge mo a'a karsha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should add, “So-and-so, I summon you.”

original: bdag nyid kyi nor dang; 'bru dang / gter la sogs pa yongs su gang bar bsams nas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nor dang; 'bru dang / gter la sogs pa yongs su gang bar bsams nas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize one’s own wealth, grain, treasure, and so forth as being filled with it, and recite the mantra.

original: bdag la pushtim ku ru zhes sbyar ba bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la pushtim ku ru zhes sbyar ba bya'o //
translated: One should add, “Grant me prosperity.”

original: rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become prosperous.

original: sngags 'dis gru gsum gnyis kha sbyar te /
analyzed: sngags 'dis gru gsum gnyis kha sbyar te /
translated: With this mantra, one should join two triangles together,

original: dbus su go la'i 'dab ma la cher mar bris te pho ba ris lnga dang bcas pa'i go la zos na rims thams cad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: dbus su go la'i 'dab ma la cher mar bris te pho ba ris lnga dang bcas pa'i go la zos na rims thams cad 'joms par byed do //
translated: and in the middle, on a myrobalan leaf, write the name of the target. If one eats the myrobalan together with the five ambrosias, one will destroy all fevers.

original: sarba dzva ram n'a sha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sarba dzva ram n'a sha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should add sarva jvaraṃ nāśaya (Destroy all fevers).

original: zla ba gzas bzung ba'am /🔽nyi ma gzas bzung ba la 'o ma'i zan nam /
analyzed: zla ba gzas bzung ba'am / nyi ma gzas bzung ba la 'o ma'i zan nam /
translated: When the moon is eclipsed,🔽or when the sun is eclipsed, one should fill a begging bowl with milk-rice,

original: zho'i zan gyis lhung bzed bkang nas /
analyzed: zho'i zan gyis lhung bzed bkang nas /
translated: or with curd-rice,

original: ka ra dang mar dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ka ra dang mar dang bcas pa /
translated: together with sugar and ghee,

original: aa shvad tha'i lo ma bdun gyis steng du bzhag nas /
analyzed: aa shvad tha'i lo ma bdun gyis steng du bzhag nas /
translated: and place it on seven leaves of the bodhi tree,

original: lo ma bdun gyis steng nas g-yogs te /🔽lag pa gnyis kyis bsten nas /
analyzed: lo ma bdun gyis steng nas g-yogs te / lag pa gnyis kyis bsten nas /
translated: and cover it with seven leaves.

original: ji srid ma grol gyi bar de srid bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid ma grol gyi bar de srid bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra as long as it is not released.

original: de zos pas lo lnga brgya thub po //
analyzed: de zos pas lo lnga brgya thub po //
translated: By eating it, one will live for five hundred years.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis ba bla'am /
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis ba bla'am /
translated: By this very method, one should practice with realgar,

original: gi wang ngam /
analyzed: gi wang ngam /
translated: or with bovine orpiment,🔽or with red arsenic,

original: ldong ros sam /🔽slang dreg la bsgrub par bya'o //🔽'bar bar gyur na thig le'am /
analyzed: ldong ros sam / slang dreg la bsgrub par bya'o // 'bar bar gyur na thig le'am /
translated: or with bitumen.🔽If it blazes, one will become a vidyādhara with a bindu,

original: mig @400a *// sman gyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig @400a *// sman gyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or with eye ointment.

original: du ba byung na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽du ba byung na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba byung na mi snang bar 'gyur ro // du ba byung na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it emits smoke, one will become invisible.

original: dro bar gyur na dbang du byed do //
analyzed: dro bar gyur na dbang du byed do //
translated: If it becomes warm, one will enthrall.

original: yang na n'a ga ge sar gyi shing gi rang bzhin la klu'i rgyal po mtha' yas bya'o //
analyzed: yang na n'a ga ge sar gyi shing gi rang bzhin la klu'i rgyal po mtha' yas bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should make the king of nāgas Ananta out of the essence of ironwood.

original: de chu'i nang du kha thur du bltas nas //
analyzed: de chu'i nang du kha thur du bltas nas //
translated: One should place him in the water, facing downward,

original: gdong nam mkhar bltas nas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: gdong nam mkhar bltas nas bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: and recite the mantra while facing the sky.

original: ha na ha na aa nan tam sh'i ghram bkshil ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ha na ha na aa nan tam sh'i ghram bkshil ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should add “Hāna hanā anantaṃ śīghram bakṣaya” [“Destroy quickly, O Ananta”].

original: lha yis char 'bebs so //
analyzed: lha yis char 'bebs so //
translated: The god will bring rain.

original: de nas mtha' yas chu nas gton te /
analyzed: de nas mtha' yas chu nas gton te /
translated: Then one should take Ananta out of the water,

original: 'o ma yis khrus byas nas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma yis khrus byas nas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: bathe him with milk, and request him to depart.

original: de nas sprin la rnam par bltas nas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sprin la rnam par bltas nas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, looking at the clouds, one should recite the mantra.

original: char rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rain will cease.

original: sarba b'a ta brishti sta mbha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sarba b'a ta brishti sta mbha ya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should add “sarva-vāta-vriṣṭi-stambhaya” [“Stop all windy rains”].

original: zhes pa ni phye dang bcas pa'i yi ge bcu'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phye dang bcas pa'i yi ge bcu'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of ten syllables with the long vowel.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags dag gi cho ga dang / snying po'i sngags kyi 'ang cho ga 'di nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags dag gi cho ga dang / snying po'i sngags kyi 'ang cho ga 'di nyid do //
translated: Likewise, this is the rite for the second and third root mantras, and also for the essence mantra.

original: dang por phreng ba'i sngags ke ta ka'i lo ma la tsher mas bris nas /
analyzed: dang por phreng ba'i sngags ke ta ka'i lo ma la tsher mas bris nas /
translated: First, write the mantra of the rosary on a ketaka leaf with a thorn.

original: gos sngon po dang / skud pa dag gis dkris nas mgo bo'am /
analyzed: gos sngon po dang / skud pa dag gis dkris nas mgo bo'am /
translated: Wrap it with blue cloth and thread, and tie it to the head,

original: dpung pa'am / mgul ba'i rgyab bam /
analyzed: dpung pa'am / mgul ba'i rgyab bam /
translated: the arm, the back of the neck,🔽or the left side.

original: g-yon par bcing bar bya'o; ;kro dha tstshe dam s'am che ge mo dzva ram n'a sha ya /
analyzed: g-yon par bcing bar bya'o; ;kro dha tstshe dam s'am che ge mo dzva ram n'a sha ya /
translated: Krodha-cāṇḍa-mahāroṣaṇa, so-and-so’s fever jvara naśaya.

original: zhes pa 'di byas pas rims thams cad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di byas pas rims thams cad 'joms par byed do //
translated: By doing this, it will destroy all fevers.

original: 'ching ba'i dus su nad pa gdong shar du phyogs par @400b byas nas /
analyzed: 'ching ba'i dus su nad pa gdong shar du phyogs par @400b byas nas /
translated: At the time of binding, having the patient face east,

original: nya bsregs pa dang / zan dang / chang la sogs pas gang ba'i kham phor gyis sbyangs nas /
analyzed: nya bsregs pa dang / zan dang / chang la sogs pas gang ba'i kham phor gyis sbyangs nas /
translated: purify with a saucer filled with roasted fish, rice, beer, and so forth.

original: 'di zo la rims la sogs pa thams cad myur du phyir dengs shig /
analyzed: 'di zo la rims la sogs pa thams cad myur du phyir dengs shig /
translated: “Eat this and quickly depart from all fevers and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das khro bo gtum po chen po'i bka' 'di nyid kyis song zhig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khro bo gtum po chen po'i bka' 'di nyid kyis song zhig /
translated: By the word of the Blessed One, Caṇḍa-mahāroṣaṇa, go!

original: gal te na yang gzhan du mi 'gro na /
analyzed: gal te na yang gzhan du mi 'gro na /
translated: If you do not go elsewhere,

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das gtum po khros pa'i ral gris til gyi tshad tsam du gtub par bya'o zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das gtum po khros pa'i ral gris til gyi tshad tsam du gtub par bya'o zhes brjod nas /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One should be visualized as Caṇḍa-Mahāroṣaṇa, cutting the patient with a sword into pieces the size of sesame seeds.

original: bden bral gyi mtshams su gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi mtshams su gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should offer the bali on the southwest border.

original: de nas bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the patient will be well.

original: de bzhin du nad dang / mkha' 'gro ma dang / bar du gcod pa thams cad la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad dang / mkha' 'gro ma dang / bar du gcod pa thams cad la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should offer bali to all the diseases, to the ḍākinīs, and to all the obstacles.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad la bklags pa tsam gyi srung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad la bklags pa tsam gyi srung bar byed do //
translated: By merely reciting [the mantra], one will be protected from all fears.

original: gzhan yang rtsa ba'i sngags brjod pas thams cad byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtsa ba'i sngags brjod pas thams cad byed do //
translated: Moreover, one should do everything by reciting the root mantra.

original: phreng ba'i sngags gnyis pa la'ang cho ga 'di nyid do //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags gnyis pa la'ang cho ga 'di nyid do //
translated: This very rite is also for the second garland mantra.

original: phreng ba'i sngags gsum pas lhag ma'i chang bu la mngon par sngags nas spyin bar bya'o //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags gsum pas lhag ma'i chang bu la mngon par sngags nas spyin bar bya'o //
translated: With the third garland mantra, one should enchant the remaining bali and offer it.

original: mchog ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain the supreme.

original: zan gyi phung po la mngon par sngags nas /
analyzed: zan gyi phung po la mngon par sngags nas /
translated: Enchanting a heap of food,

original: phyi dro'i dus su dben pa'i phyogs su sbyin par lbya'o //
analyzed: phyi dro'i dus su dben pa'i phyogs su sbyin par lbya'o //
translated: one should offer it in a secluded place in the evening.

original: bya ba gang gi phyogs la des thams cad 'grub pa //
analyzed: bya ba gang gi phyogs la des thams cad 'grub pa //
translated: Whatever rite one performs, it will all be accomplished.

original: cho ga lhag ma ni sngon ma bzhin no //
analyzed: cho ga lhag ma ni sngon ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest of the rite is the same as before.

original: cho ga gsngon ma bzhin du dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid nya gang ba'i bar sngon bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga gsngon ma bzhin du dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid nya gang ba'i bar sngon bzhin du bya'o //
translated: As before, beginning from the first day of the bright fortnight, one should perform the rite until the full moon.

original: @401a *// phreng ba'i sngags rnams kyi stong phrag bcus sngon du bsnyen par bya'o //
analyzed: @401a *// phreng ba'i sngags rnams kyi stong phrag bcus sngon du bsnyen par bya'o //
translated: The mantras of the garlands should be repeated ten thousand times as the preliminary.

original: lha rnams kyi bye brag gi sngags rnams rtsa ba'i sngags kyi cho ga bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi bye brag gi sngags rnams rtsa ba'i sngags kyi cho ga bzhin du'o //
translated: The mantras of the different deities should be performed according to the root mantra rite.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi cho ga ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi cho ga ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One's mantra rite is as it is.

original: de bzhin du lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: Likewise, the goddesses' is the same.

original: khyad par du phreng ba'i sngags bzlas pas /
analyzed: khyad par du phreng ba'i sngags bzlas pas /
translated: In particular, by reciting the garland mantra,

original: snyan dngags mkhan dang / pandi ta nyid du myur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyan dngags mkhan dang / pandi ta nyid du myur du 'gyur ro //
translated: one will quickly become a poet and a paṇḍita.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags gsum pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags gsum pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the three root mantras.

original: mal gyi steng du lag pa g-yon pas ling+ga bzung nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mal gyi steng du lag pa g-yon pas ling+ga bzung nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: On one's bed, holding the liṅga with the left hand, one should repeat [the mantra] one hundred and eight times.

original: gang gi ming gang yin pa de 'ong bar byed de /
analyzed: gang gi ming gang yin pa de 'ong bar byed de /
translated: The one whose name one says will come.

original: 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod par bya'o //
translated: One should desire.

original: sngags ni / aom boo ha ri che ge mo me a'a y'a tu h'um h'um phat/
analyzed: sngags ni / aom boo ha ri che ge mo me a'a y'a tu h'um h'um phat/
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ, Vāri, so-and-so, come here! Hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ!

original: btsag gis bha ga la kun nas byugs nas /
analyzed: btsag gis bha ga la kun nas byugs nas /
translated: Having anointed the bhaga with madder,

original: sa la lag pa g-yon pas brten nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa la lag pa g-yon pas brten nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: one should recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times, supporting oneself on the left hand on the ground.

original: gang gi ming yin pa de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ming yin pa de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The one whose name [one says] will come.

original: nyungs kar la lan bdun du mngon par sngags nas skyes bu la bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: nyungs kar la lan bdun du mngon par sngags nas skyes bu la bsnun par bya'o //
translated: Having enchanted white mustard seeds seven times, one should strike the person.

original: nad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be free from illness.

original: yid kyis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine.

original: chu la yongs su bzlas nas bsnun na khrag 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la yongs su bzlas nas bsnun na khrag 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted water, one should strike [the person]. Blood will flow.

original: gos la yongs su bzlas nas bsnun na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos la yongs su bzlas nas bsnun na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted cloth, one should strike [the person]. All people will be pleased.

original: lan tshva la yongs su bzlas nas gang gi rkang pa'i sen mo la byin na de dbang du byed do //
analyzed: lan tshva la yongs su bzlas nas gang gi rkang pa'i sen mo la byin na de dbang du byed do //
translated: Having enchanted salt, one should give it to the toenails of the one [whose name one says]. He will be enthralled.

original: ba lang gi @401b spu'i thag pa sngags kyis mngon par bsngags nas gang gi mgul du bcings pa de ba lang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi @401b spu'i thag pa sngags kyis mngon par bsngags nas gang gi mgul du bcings pa de ba lang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one ties a rope of ox hair around someone's neck, incanting it with the mantra, he will become an ox.

original: nyi ma la mngon par phyogs nas gang gi ming nas mngon par bzlas pa de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhum bu'i spu'i thag pa gang gi mgul bar bcings pa de zhum bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma la mngon par phyogs nas gang gi ming nas mngon par bzlas pa de 'ong bar 'gyur ro // zhum bu'i spu'i thag pa gang gi mgul bar bcings pa de zhum bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats the mantra while facing the sun, the one whose name one utters will come.🔽 If one ties a rope of cat hair around someone's neck, he will become a cat.

original: bya rog gi rgyus pa'i srad bus bya rog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya rog gi rgyus pa'i srad bus bya rog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one ties a rope of crow sinew around someone's neck, he will become a crow.

original: skyes bu'i skra'i srad bus skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i skra'i srad bus skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one ties a rope of human hair around someone's neck, he will become a man.

original: bud med kyi skra'i srad bus bud med du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med kyi skra'i srad bus bud med du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one ties a rope of female hair around someone's neck, he will become a woman.

original: de bzhin du gang dang / gang gi spu la sogs pa'i srad bus byas pas de dang / de'i gzugs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dang / gang gi spu la sogs pa'i srad bus byas pas de dang / de'i gzugs nyid du 'gyur ro //
